Rule Detail: TAS components: The combination of all the elements that make up the TAS must match the Treasury Central Accounting Reporting System (CARS). AgencyIdentifier, MainAccountCode, and SubAccountCode are always required. AllocationTransferAgencyIdentifier, BeginningPeriodOfAvailability, EndingPeriodOfAvailability and AvailabilityTypeCode are required if present in the CARS table.
Explanation of Rule: Compare the combinaiton of TAS subcomponents to TAS table to external CARS & see if they match.
Comments: Need some process for keeping TAS file up to date

Rule Detail: BudgetAuthorityAvailableAmountTotal_CPE = BudgetAuthorityAppropriatedAmount_CPE + BudgetAuthorityUnobligatedBalanceBroughtForward_FYB + AdjustmentsToUnobligatedBalanceBroughtForward_CPE + OtherBudgetaryResourcesAmount_CPE
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: OtherBudgetaryResourcesAmount_CPE = ContractAuthorityAmountTotal_CPE + BorrowingAuthorityAmountTotal_CPE + SpendingAuthorityfromOffsettingCollectionsAmountTotal_CPE
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: StatusOfBudgetaryResourcesTotal_CPE= ObligationsIncurredTotalByTAS_CPE + UnobligatedBalance_CPE
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: BudgetAuthorityAvailableAmountTotal_CPE= CPE value for GTAS SF 133 line #1910
Explanation of Rule: For that TAS, compare File A element submission to SF 133 line from GTAS.
Action to Take: Go to GTAS, look up TAS specified in submission row & bring back value for SF 133 specified line & validate match to element value.

Rule Detail: All the elements that have FYB in file A, B & C would be expected in quarter 1, as a soft edit. It would be optional in subsequent periods.
Explanation of Rule: If it's Q1, there should be a value for elements for FYB.
Action to Take: Look at Reporting Period in Metadata.If between Oct-Dec then value is expected.
Comments: If reporting period overlaps with Q1, all elements with "FYB" in the title are required.

Rule Detail: Submitted value must match corresponding GTAS value (see specific rule)
Explanation of Rule: This is a spaceholder for a specific rule. If there's a rule not already specified, then there will be one.
Action to Take: Elements that have Rule A17 should also have others rules defined.

Rule Detail: GrossOutlayAmountByTAS_CPE (file A) = sum of all GrossOutlayAmountByProgramObjectClass (file B) {When not disaggregated by Program Activity and Object Class, this value is the sum of all Gross Outlay Amounts reported in file B, by TAS/Subaccount}
Explanation of Rule: Gross Outlay Amount By TAS in File A must match the sum of Gross Outlay Amount By Program Object Class in File B, by TAS.
Action to Take: For the TAS in each submission row in File A, match to same TAS in File B, sum GrossOutlayAmountByProgramObjectClass (including blank prog actv & obj cls), and validate match to GrossOutlayAmountByTAS_CPE in File A.

Rule Detail: ObligationsIncurredTotalByTAS_CPE (File A) = sum of ObligationsIncurredByProgramObjectClass_CPE (File B)
Explanation of Rule: Obligations Incurred Total By TAS in File A must match the sum of Obligations Incurred By Program Object Class in File B, by TAS.
Action to Take: For the TAS in each submission row in File A, match to same TAS in File B, sum ObligationsIncurredByProgramObjectClass_CPE (including blank prog actv & obj cls), and validate match to ObligationsIncurredTotalByTAS_CPE in File A.

Rule Detail: Must be valid Agency ID in the Common Government-wide Accounting Classification (CGAC)
Explanation of Rule: The Agency ID is defined in CGAC
Action to Take: Match value to CGAC Agency Codes tab in Domain Values file.

Rule Detail: Only acceptable values are x and [blank]
Explanation of Rule: For availability type codes, the only acceptable values are X and [blank].
Action to Take: JW: Implemented as IN_SET because of earlier version
Comments: Implemented as IN_SET because of earlier version

Explanation of Rule: For that TAS, compare File A element submission to SF 133 line from GTAS.
Action to Take: Go to GTAS, look up TAS specified in submission row & bring back value for SF 133 specified line & validate match to element value.

Rule Detail: StatusOfBudgetaryResourcesTotal_CPE = BudgetAuthorityAvailableAmountTotal_CPE
Explanation of Rule: In File A, both of these elements must per match, per TAS
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: BorrowingAuthorityAmountTotal_CPE must be provided if TAS has borrowing authority per CARS or GTAS. If no borrowing authority on TAS, leave blank.
Explanation of Rule: If the TAS has Borrowing Authority, then we expect an amount for BorrowingAuthorityAmountTotal_CPE
Action to Take: For the TAS in the submitted row, go to CARS table & look for???
Comments: What does it mean to have borrowing authority?  Will need a new rule type since it's required to be absent if no borrowing authority

Rule Detail: ContractAuthorityAmountTotal_CPE must be provided if TAS has contract authority per CARS or GTAS. If no contract authority on TAS, leave blank.
Explanation of Rule: If the TAS has Contract Authority, then we expect an amount for ContractAuthorityAmountTotal_CPE
Action to Take: For the TAS in the submitted row, go to CARS table & look for???
Comments: What does it mean to have contract authority?

Rule Detail: SpendingAuthorityfromOffsettingCollectionsAmountTotal_CPE must be provided if TAS has spending authority per CARS or GTAS. If no spending authority on TAS, leave blank.
Explanation of Rule: If the TAS has Spending Authority, then we expect an amount for SpendingAuthorityfromOffsettingCollectionsAmountTotal_CPE
Action to Take: For the TAS in the submitted row, go to CARS table & look for???
Comments: What does it mean to have spending authority?

Rule Detail: OtherBudgetaryResourcesAmount_CPE must be provided if TAS has borrowing, contract or spending authority per CARS or GTAS. If not applicable, leave blank.
Explanation of Rule: If the TAS has Other Budgetary Resources, then we expect an amount for OtherBudgetaryResourcesAmount_CPE
Action to Take: For the TAS in the submitted row, go to CARS table & look for???

Rule Detail: DeobligationsRecoveriesRefundsByTAS_CPE = CPE aggregate value for GTAS SF 133 line (1021 + 1081) + (1033 + 1093)
Explanation of Rule: For that TAS, compare File A element submission to SF 133 line from GTAS.
Action to Take: Go to GTAS, look up TAS specified in submission row & bring back value for SF 133 specified line & validate match to element value.

Rule Detail: ObligationsUndeliveredOrdersUnpaidTotal (FYB or CPE) = USSGL(4801 + 4831 + 4871 + 4881). This applies to the program activity and object class level.
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: ObligationsDeliveredOrdersUnpaidTotal (FYB or CPE) = USSGL(4901 + 4931 + 4971 + 4981). This applies to the program activity and object class level.
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: GrossOutlayAmountByProgramObjectClass (FYB or CPE, File B) = GrossOutlaysUndeliveredOrdersPrepaidTotal (FYB or CPE, File B) + GrossOutlaysDeliveredOrdersPaidTotal (FYB or CPE, File B)
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: GrossOutlaysUndeliveredOrdersPrepaidTotal (FYB or CPE) = USSGL(4802 + 4832 + 4872+ 4882). This applies to the program activity and object class level.
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: GrossOutlaysDeliveredOrdersPaidTotal (FYB or CPE)= USSGL(4902 + 4908 + 4972 + 4982). This applies to the program activity and object class level.
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: Must be a valid program activity name for the corresponding TAS/TAFS as defined in Section 82 of OMB Circular A-11.
Explanation of Rule: The name must be consistent with what's in the president's budget
Comments: Will this be in domain values?

Rule Detail: Must be a valid program activity code for the corresponding TAS/TAFS as defined in Section 82 of OMB Circular A-11.
Explanation of Rule: The code must be consistent with what's in the president's budget
Comments: Will this be in domain values?

Rule Detail: Must be valid 3-digit object class as defined in OMB Circular A-11 Section 83.6, or a 4-digit code which includes a 1-digit prefix that distinguishes direct, reimbursable, and allocation obligations. Do not include decimal points when reporting in the Schema.
Explanation of Rule: The code must be consistent with what's in the president's budget
Action to Take: Match value to Object Class Codes tab in Domain Values file.

Rule Detail: Reimbursable flag indicator is required when reporting obligation or outlay USSGL account balances (excluding downward adjustments SGL accounts). Valid values are "R" for "ReimbursableFundingSource" and "D" for "DirectFundingSource".
Explanation of Rule: For USSGL 48XX & 49XX (except 487X & 497X), required to have 'D' or 'R'.
Action to Take: For USSGL 48XX & 49XX (except 487X & 497X), required to have 'D' or 'R'.
Comments: Will require this field to be present if any of specified USSGL numbers are present

Rule Detail: DeobligationsRecoveriesRefundsdOfPriorYearByProgramObjectClass_CPE = USSGL(4871+ 4872 + 4971 + 4972)
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
Action to Take: JW: ready

Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: GrossOutlayAmountByAward (FYB or CPE, File C) = GrossOutlaysUndeliveredOrdersPrepaidTotal (FYB or CPE, File C) + GrossOutlaysDeliveredOrdersPaidTotal (FYB or CPE, File C)
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements

Rule Detail: Unique FAIN/URI from file C exists in file D2
Explanation of Rule: There is an award reported in C that links to D2, by FAIN/URI
Action to Take: JW: ready?

Rule Detail: Unique FAIN/URI from file D2 exists in file C, except D2 records with zero FederalActionObligation
Explanation of Rule: There is FAIN/URI reported in D2 that links to an award in C, unless there's no new activity in D2.
Action to Take: JW: ready?

Rule Detail: Unique PIID, ParentAwardId from file C exists in file D1
Explanation of Rule: There is an award reported in C that links to D1, by PIID, ParentAwardId
Action to Take: JW: D1 not included yet?

Rule Detail: Unique PIID, ParentAwardId from file D1 exists in file C, except D1 records with zero FederalActionObligation
Explanation of Rule: There is PIID, ParentAwardId reported in D1 that links to an award in C, unless there's no new activity in D1.
Action to Take: JW: D1 not included yet?

Rule Detail: If FAIN is not provided then provide URI
Action to Take: JW: ready?
Comments: Including PIID in this rule, one of the three must be present

Rule Detail: Not Required on rows that include values for USSGL accounts balances or subtotals
Explanation of Rule: This is for transactions not for USSGL amounts from the financial system.
Action to Take: JW: ready

Rule Detail: DeobligationsRecoveriesRefundsOfPriorYearByAward_CPE = USSGL(4871+ 4872 + 4971 + 4972). This applies to the award level.
Explanation of Rule: The first element is a total of the other elements
